rule_name.description:
Description

Checks that method names conform to a specified pattern.


Also, checks if a method name has the same name as the residing class.
The default is false (it is not allowed). It is legal in Java to have
method with the same name as a class. As long as a return type is specified
it is a method and not a constructor which it could be easily confused as.
Does not check-style the name of an overridden methods because the developer
does not have a choice in renaming such methods.
rule_name.option:
allowClassName, Control whether to allow a method name to have the same name as the enclosing class name. Setting this property false helps to avoid confusion between constructors and methods., boolean, false
applyToPackage, Control if check should apply to package-private members., boolean, true
applyToPrivate, Control if check should apply to private members., boolean, true
applyToProtected, Control if check should apply to protected members., boolean, true
applyToPublic, Control if check should apply to public members., boolean, true
format, Sets the pattern to match valid identifiers., Pattern, "^[a-z][a-zA-Z0-9]*$"
